intro: Stenomesson incarnatum, commonly known as the red-stemmed broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant features slender, reddish stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Stenomesson incarnatum is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
